page.title: 13MR WATKINS OF DEFYNNOG
page.content: I wake up at 7.15 am. I am usually the first one up so I make the morning pot of tea. Once I used to make one or two cups but now it is three or four. At 8.40 am I set out for work, before I go I buy a paper and drop the children off at school. When I get to Brecon I have to attend a meeting. After the meeting I go to a coffee - shop with a few colleagues. At 12.00 noon I get a lift to Craig-y-nos country park where I am a warden. The jobs vary with the weather and season, today I showed some children around the grounds, then I mowed the lawns. I catch the bus home go for a run and have tea. Shortly after 11.00 pm I go to bed. (27/6/85 B.Watkins.) (Transcribed by Thomas Watkins)
